p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: MS annotated 'No 8' of 74 receipts covering materials supplied via the Botanic Garden for the Intercolonial Exhibition of Australasia, Melbourne, 1866-7, for which M was one of the Commissioners.

seg.seg: STEAM SAW, MOULDING, & GRAIN CRUSHING MILLS,

p.seg: TIMBER MERCHANTS, WOOD TURNERS, & BILLIARD TABLE MANUFACTURERS.
Doors, Window Sashes, Solid and Cut Deals, Weatherboards, Lining-Boards, Battens, Cedar, &c., always on hand.

11
There are ticks beside each of the first two amounts and the total.
